TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WebPartManagerDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides minimal design-time support for controls.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WebPartManagerDesigner class provides a bare-minimum design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control. It appears on the design surface as a plain gray box showing the name of the class and the ID of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager>. You can change the rendering of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in the same manner as with any standard <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is overridden to always return `true`.
## Examples The following code example shows how to change the design-time appearance of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method of the designer.
[!code-cs[WebPartsDesigners_WebPartManagerDesigner_Overview#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_23_1.cs)] [!code-vb[WebPartsDesigners_WebPartManagerDesigner_Overview#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_23_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an empty string (""), which indicates that the visual design environment should revert to default control rendering.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.param: The control associated with the designer.
Docs.summary: Binds the designer to the associated control.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.
